    • Field Detail

      • name

        public java.lang.String name
        An arbitrary name that can be assigned to this spectrum for identification purposes.

      • specType

        public java.lang.String specType
        An arbitrary name to identify the type of this spectrum, like COSY, NOESY, HSQC, etc. I decided not to provide static Strings with given experiment type since the there are numerous experiments yielding basically identical information having different names

      • shiftList

        public java.util.List<java.util.List> shiftList
        This holds sorted list of Chemical Shifts of all axes. The first dimension addresses the axes, the second the shift values in this axis, starting from the highest value.

      • pickPrecision

        public float[] pickPrecision
        Not yet clear if this is needed.

      • dim

        public int dim
        Declares how many axes are in involved in this spectrum.

      • nucleus

        public java.lang.String[] nucleus
        The nuclei of the different axes.

      • spectrometerFrequency

        public float spectrometerFrequency
        The proton frequency of the spectrometer used to record this spectrum.

        public java.lang.String solvent

      • pickClosestSignal

        public java.lang.Object pickClosestSignal(float shift,
                                          java.lang.String nnucleus,
                                          float pickprecision)
        Returns the signal closest to the shift sought. If no Signal is found within the interval defined by pickprecision, null is returned.

      • pickSignals

        public java.util.List pickSignals(float shift,
                                  java.lang.String nnucleus,
                                  float pickprecision)
        Returns a List with signals within the interval defined by pickprecision. If none is found an empty List is returned.

      • report

        public void report()
        Creates a 2D matrix of booleans, that models the set of crosspeaks in the 2D NMR spectrum. The dimensions are taken from hetAtomShiftList and protonShiftList, which again are produced by updateShiftLists based a collection of 2D nmrSignals

        private void createMatrix(){ boolean found; float het, prot; int hetPos, protPos; hetCorMatrix = new boolean[hetAtomShiftList.length][protonShiftList.length]; for (int f = 0; f < size(); f++){ HetCorNMRSignal hetCorSignal = (HetCorNMRSignal)elementAt(f); prot = hetCorSignal.shift[NMRSignal.SHIFT_PROTON]; het = hetCorSignal.shift[NMRSignal.SHIFT_HETERO]; found = false; hetPos = isInShiftList(hetAtomShiftList, het, hetAtomShiftList.length); if (hetPos >= 0){ protPos = isInShiftList(protonShiftList, prot, protonShiftList.length); if ( protPos >= 0){ found = true; hetCorMatrix[hetPos][protPos] = true; } } } }
